pageContext.claim: “And what Turkey is getting now [with the ceasefire] is they're not going to have to kill millions of people, and millions of people aren't going to have to kill them. I mean, this was going to be a war of lots of other groups coming in; this wasn't going to stop with Turkey against the Kurds.”
pageContext.analysis: Turkey has issues with the Syrian Defense Forces {which are} connected to the PKK, a long standing enemy of the Turkish state, but that conflict never meant they were going to have to “kill millions of people.” The U.S. presence along the border had prevented a Turkish persecution of Syrian Kurds.
